As long as anyone has gazed onto this tiny square of the net (Roughly 0.0000001% of populace), I have been in all sorts of colorful moods, ranging from "You're unique, just like everyone else", "Everyone seems normal until you get to know them", and "Never miss a good chance to shut up".
Ah, those were the days.
This is just like graduating from school away from all those retards who bother you.

Those two reasons because they tend to bitch at eachother and cause me entertainment.

    So it's been awhile since I last posted test results, bite me. I just go crazy with these personality tests... Lotsa stuff to accomplish yet. But they will be done.

I'm surprised there isn't moss covering the text boxes and cobwebs attached to the corners between the letters.
Ain't much here now. Guess you could say I have moved on. I am content with the old, and if anyone comes and trys to rattle my nerves...
I'll kick your bloody arse so hard you'll kiss the moon!

The problem is noone can see the expressions I make, or the emotion of the situation when typing on the cold-hearted cube.
Most people of the human consciousness, and I do mean, pretty much 85% of the people I've met in my life, both past and recent have no idea what the meaning of thier existance is.
Evil or good? Human concept... I am trying to see things you guys' way, but unfortunately, I can't get my head the far up my arse.

For Christ's sake... Grow the fuck up and quit acting like a bunch of 7th grade retards.
What I'm trying to say is, I belong everywhere, and have no home. Where-as most people have no emotion, and yet live in obscurity.

Well... That is what was on my mind today, and perhaps for the longest time, and with no significant other to share life with.
I shall now watch my family crumble away... And finally be alone, as it may be written in the stars.
I have no home, I exist everywhere. The alpha and the omega, without the religious stuff.

~Ravings of a song passionate lunatic.

Personal
--------------

1. FURRY NAME: Most people call me "Kit". My other name/s are secret.
2. REAL NAME: Joseph McCloud
3. AGE & BIRTHDAY: 21, July 20th, 1981
4. LOCATION: Kenosha, WI
5. SPECIES: Grayish pale fox. It goes with mood, the color of my fur. Sometimes red, sometimes white, but predominant pale.
6. UNIQUITY (What makes you unique?): Unique... To sum up most of this question, listen to "HIGH HOPES" by "PINK FLOYD". You should get some idea of what I am talking about. I am indeed, the most unique person/furry I have ever known. I may not like the things I do at times, but it is a relationship that lifelong friends have, am I right? ...My problem is; I have so much on my mind. I need to tell someone. I wonder if anyone is that patient, or if they in fact do have want to listen. I am mostly adventuristic. I am not meant to be barred down by office work, or a job the goes no-where. A FREE-SPIRIT, born with fire in his blood was never meant to be locked away inside of a house. The open road and friends are a dream come true. And most of you agree with me, so you don't have to hide it. I am a pale fox in my mind; cold and contemplative, I am a thinker. It goes with my mood, as I have stated. I live out my charactor, so you can be sure that I am not acting at all when we meet. My dark exterior hides my true self, but there is none so far strong enough to crack it, in person. My tail is who I am. The fox is one of the most inteligent creatures you will ever know.

Occupations
--------------------

7. SCHOOL/WORK: Graduated in 1999. I am assistant curator for the local museum.
8. HOBBIES: Anime, hiking, walking, swimming, reading, writing, movies, video games,  Japanese culture (writing and language included), sleep, friends, thinking, and art. My info section lists the rest.
9: WHAT FURRY RESOURCES DO YOU USE?: I am not mainstream... If I was, that leaves me open to back-biting closed minds. My friends are my true family.
10. WHAT DO YOU USE TO CHAT WITH OTHER FURRIES?: AIM. I also respond to replys in this livejournal. 
11: ICQ#? AOL SN? MSN? Yahoo? LiveJournal? This is a redundant question, and I prefer to poke fun at it than typing in a simple, short answer.

Random Questions
------------------------------

12: WHAT'S THE FIRST THING YOU DO WHEN YOU WAKE UP? I am mistaken. I assumed that I lived in reality. I normally try to keep the light from burning my retina's.
13: WHAT'S THE LAST THING YOU DO BEFORE GOING TO SLEEP? I listen to MY music. If it was your music, then I would not have my individuality, like most of the robots in the military.
14: WHAT'S YOUR LEAST FAVORITE FOOD? Mayonaise........ *Shudders.* Do not get me started.
15: IF YOU CAN GO BACK IN TIME, WHERE WOULD YOU GO AND WHY? Going back in time will not be easy. I intend to become a PROPHET to myself, like the great Magus once was.
16: WHAT'S THE FURTHEST PLACE YOU VISITED FROM YOUR PRESENT LOCATION? Okinawa, Japan. Lived for three years, better memories there than here.
17. WHAT'S YOUR FAVORITE NATIONALITY FOR FOOD? Japanese, Irish, Scottish... My list goes on.
18. NAME ONE PERSON YOU KNOW WHO'S 24 YEARS OLD. No-one you know... Not anyone's business unless they really want to know.
19. HOW MUCH MONEY IS IN YOUR WALLET RIGHT NOW? No wallet. I keep my only wallet in my relics box. It was gained in the summer of 1992, before I moved to Hell... I mean Wisconsin. My money ammount is my concern, not anyone elses. Unless it was an emergency.
20. HOW/WHEN DID YOU DISCOVER FURRY: I don't remember... I have always been an anthromorphic person. It started with one of my favorite DISNEY cartoons, "Robin Hood". Hence the fox... I could bore you forever, with my thoughts, but I tend to go from subject to subject.
21. SAY SOMETHING ABOUT THE PERSON YOU YANKED THIS FROM: I met a new, possible friend... His name will be kept safe, locked in the vault of my mind for safety.

...But due to a recurance of sinful memories, that happiness has been canceled. Good day. I will instead leave a few test results and hope that some one has XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX. (End text subverted to make this sound at the least pleasant. Afterall, everyone is a splitpersonality, just... like... I...) I'll curator you! (Threatens by swinging a peice of mammoth bone from the local museum menacingly over his head.) *Hugs* ~Kit out...

I have lucid dreams almost every night. I envy my otherworldly counterpart.
In my dream last night I saw a girl who looked familiar. She was in her group of friends, but I did not care, for I walked right up to her and began to talk. These kinds of things don't go smoothly in reality.
I saw her house. I only saw her parents briefly. The house was not in the best of shape. A moster was after her... A shadowy creature that was featureless to describe. The girl seemed to feel safe with me...
If that happened in reality, then dreams would have no boundaries.
Things like that are rare in this world... I want to do something like that, if it gave me a chance to find what I'm looking for.

My grandfather used to tape movies for us kids... But I have noone who shares my sympathy. My memories will never go away, they always come back to remind me of how I want to be. I have an affinity for disney. Maybe because it is my true self in reality. Am I really as crazy as a Loony Toons charactor, or is that the facade? Maybe I am as deep as a Disney charactor, and noone wants to dig. Or maybe I am a mix of both. It would be stupid to jump to conclusions without further research. 
Or maybe I am a Don Bluth... A movie that mimics reality and merges both the deepness of Disney with ultra high levels of novel fantasy.

You make friends by talking it seems. What are the odds the person you can see being a friend will actually agree with you firstoff? Will they eventually tell you that they are your friend? I wish I could see into the minds of people I meet. That would make it easy to decide.

Only inquisitive people will want to know me. So far I don't know any.
Inquisitive by means of having to ask me yourselves instead of me complaining all the time.

I can't write everything I want to here from the past several days...
But today I did something different. I went outside in the cold, and released some of my pent up rage by raking leaves, and hacking away at the bush that blocks part of the parking space in our backyard. Also helped my sister carve her pumpkin, in the cold. My hands were dirty enough anyway. Not much happened between then and now.

My E-mail is fucked up... It doesn't matter. What's in a name. The bastard will get his/hers soon.

About half an hour ago to an hour my nose bled like mad. Minor headache. It continued to bleed before I got an evil idea for its use. In my left hand I let my blood drip until there was enough to coat both lenses of my glasses. I slipped them on and looked in the mirror.
It was... Not like me to say the least, but I thought it looked rather cool. Washed them off.
I continued to bleed for several odd minutes, then tiredness began to set in. I don't know what I was thinking, but I know that I was controlling my own movements when I smeared my beard and mustache with my own blood.
It is kinda funny. The blood enhances the color of my already red facial hair. Go figure. The blood also has an interesting feeling when applied to the lips.

Who the hell is gonna read this anyway? =)
My livejournal never has any comments. But, who am I to contend with those on top of the popularity chain. Popularity is for the blinded. And Kurt Cobain knew it. I may or may not read his private journals. I have some respect for the dead in me yet.

By any chance anyone is reading this, all of it, I don't ask for much... Just a one word reply, any word of your choice.

~Kit, uninteresting and alone... the past was once my home... Look how much I haven't grown... Wish I had found my double........

Before I get started, I will explain the events of Saturday and Sunday briefly while listening to particularly angst-filled lyrics (Chop Suey, among others).

6pm,7pm-Sat: Tremaine came over. I borrowed Donnie Darko from Jova again and brought it to Tremaines with the intention of having it watched. Mission success... Or was it?
At his and his friend, Blackberry's home I sat on the couch after feeling the awkwardness that always happens in the home of others. Nervousness? Or perhaps it was the guilt kicking in. The small crowd also accompanied the familiar faces of Daveqat, Joe, and BJ.

730pm,830pm: We left for a chinese restaurant similar to Kings Buffet, but much more crowded. We ate, and I immediately noticed the wierd feeling that may require the ability of a surgeon. Not too much discomfort. I ate my plates full of breaded chicken, rice and shrimp while listening to the discussion between the other five.
I may not have known any of them for very long, but I know from the times I did that Joe tends to smile. None of my business, though I think that there might've been something bothering him.

9pm,???: Returned to Blackberry's pad and watched movies.

2am,???: Daveqat left, Joe had been asleep for awhile and Tremaine retired to bed. I remain restless, trying to put myself to sleep. I don't think it was the alcoholic drinks I had that was keeping me up. This was like the first day I had in the military...

4am,???: Unexpectedly, my nose begins to bleed. I wander to the bathroom and begin the process of stopping the blood flow whilst BJ and Blackberry watch an old Fantastic Four cartoon. I spend about 20 minutes in the bathroom... Good thing I cleaned up the mess, otherwise I would not be a very good guest..........

Skipping ahead: I notice a lot of things about others by keeping my pie-hole shut and observing. I won't get into it too much here, but I will add that they tend to "speak thier mind". I can relate with the group in some places. Curse my duel persona..


Went to the physician today. Whoop-dee-doo! He told me the same thing that I had already figured out days beforehand in my medical book. What a waste of 75 dollars... At least it's not cancer. I will have surgury in a few weeks, which I am not looking forward to for one reason only... Guilt.

There are songs that everyone keeps dear and near to thier heart and soul. But, not everyone realizes that they themselves are modeled after a particular song that has already been created.
I believe I am a rare exception, that I have multiple such "Theme songs".
I've been called many things, by my friend's and foe's:
Hopeless Romantic, Sly, a Good Person, an A**hole, Psychotic, Depressed, Crazy, Lost, Pathetic, Knuckle Head, Mother F***er, Bastard, Four Eyes, Sad, Unstable, Suicidal, F***-Up, Idiot, Lazy, Hyper, Energetic, Sullen, I Wish You Were Dead, Punk, God, Worthless, Unable To Cope, Coward, Scarred For Life...... The list goes on and on and on.
There are others. I'd post if I could remember them all. I think my mood just changed again.
All I need now is to see a halucination of an evil brown bunny predicting the end of the world at the end of October. I should only be so lucky.
Animals can be humanized. How do you explain your pet dog or cat? But, is it us who are smart? Or have we just forgotten how much we used to be like them? Animals...
I feel mxed between emotions..
MY ENEMIES LIST: Shaun St. Marten, Mathew Del Rosario, Michael Lee Campbell, Jason Drinkwine, Peter Henry, Jason Rolens, Michael Munns, Michael Sebena, Richard Walters, Mathew Tucker, Luke Young.
These names I reflect on and feel rage. My current mood has flipped again, and now I am feeling a sense of accomplishment. I have it better than any and all of the names I have listed. Punks, Troublemakers, Losers, Rapists, Womanizers... two IQ pointed expletives. 
I will qoute a line from one of my favorite songs, You Get What You Give: 
You're all fakes 
Run to your mansions 
Come around 
I'll kick your ass in...

Rants of a lunatic. This world ends when I die. Hidden rage facades behind a wall of compressed hatred, being held at bay by both the inner child and the hopeless romantic listening to advise from his only friends of this world.
Thank you Mario. You are a good person, and I am glad to have met you.
My other friends I will thank too, at least they speak to me. =)

~Kit, in between emotions at the moment. Let's test our frame.

The music is so eerie. When I watched "DD" for the first time, the screen was small, and the sound was mono. But this time, I watched it on the 28" screen with surround; The picture and sound were even greater...
I will get my songs, or kill Limewire. Preferably both.

*Tailwaves*

It has been weeks, or days since I've been able to come and write anything. These past few days things have been going all "Donnie Darko" with me. And today is no exception.
I feel that I should be on anti-depressants.
I can tell the future, but it is not a voluntary skill. It is "Super-Involuntary", and sketchy at best. I can remember my dreams fluently, but I never remember "Deja-vu", that is until it actually happens to me. But by then it's too late to do anything about it.
I live my day as it happens, but a little foresight helps me.
I don't feel like doing anything creative today, other than feeling horrible and drained. No amount of dream has told me of anything useful these past few days.
I wish I could see more of my friends. I could use an adventure out in the rain.
I feel I need to be wandering the world right now, physically, searching for something. Maybe my wish will come true. Most of them.
I have selected my Halloween costume I want. No one will know, except Jova, what is is.
(Sidetracked) 
Anyway, it seems most of my friends are spiritual, which is a big plus to me. Someday we will begin our nationwide travel, perhaps...
I don't feel like talking on AIM today, I'll do it later when creativity knocks.
I wish my friends never have to see me depressed. It has happened already. I find myself appologizing for no reason. I do it from force of habit.
My previous week was something to go through, and wonder how I made it past it.
One of my friends owns a jeep and came to my house to pick up me and a friend. Before she came, she took a "acid"... She has a crush on me, but I don't take drugs. Good thing she retained her driving skills, cause the lights from other cars seemed to affect her vision.
My life is similar to "Donnie Darko's", except I don't let some rabbit from the future tell me what to do.
Enjoy my insatity while it's here. Thank you, all of my friends who read my rantings, and sometimes give me lectures of hope.

~Kit

Saturday 14th, 2002

The anticipation for the event of the day was getting to me. It started out with me waking up to the faint smell of the past. A day from a memory long ago filled the air in my house, as it was a particularly good day.
   It felt no different today. I began the day (Starting at 1-PM) using some of my freetime to clean up a bit of the upstairs, helping my family members with thier various doings, and keeping my distance from my father. 
   Later on my parents fled the house, leaving my sister and I behind to watch "UHF". "I hope you enjoy it!!", I shouted at her as she put it into my PS2. After an hour and a half of "Weird Al's" lunacy, I began to get ready to go to Tremaine's.
   Success! I fit all that I planned to bring with me inside of a bag, put it along with another bag inside of a large duffel and zipped it shut. Who know's how much I can lift? The bag was fairly easy to pick up, despite it's decieving weight. Tremaine arrived just as he said he would. A friend indeed, as friends are tough to find and keep; I hope things don't go sour...
   Once inside of the fox's car, I felt even more at ease, yet still nervous. The pleasant smell of sour cherry's lingered about the cabin as I concentrated on keeping my nerves as calm as I could. Just a ten minute drive, and yet, if that ten minute drive had taken much longer, I would not have minded at all. Travel is in my blood, and we all know that a bit of adventure can go a long way. We arrived...

It started out like any other social event that I had gone to before: I entered Tremaine's domain, and was immediatly stared upon by the various wildlife from one location to another, like a new member of a secret society. I eased myself by snatching a couple of pretzels from a nearby bowl of the counter, and looking about the room for familiar faces.
   Daveqat was there, sitting on the couch, inviting me to sit next to him. Looking around some more I came upon a fellow of whom I met a few weeks ago, by the name of Kich. At the table to my right were two more of whom I know, Ms. Werellama and Joe, both going head to head in a card game of "Harry Potter". Mistletoe stood inside of the kitchen, talking amongst fellow furry's.
   After a while of standing about like a NAVY recruit at attention, I decided to make my way over to the couch, using my swift fox/catlike agility to stumble over randomly placed furry's and objects. Made it! The couch was comfortable, but cramped. I sat there for a moment before having an arm wrapped around me by Daveqat. He pulled me closer, and I immediatly fell into a spell of affectionation. The feeling of your presence being needed overcame my other thought of nervousness and put me at even more ease. I sat in his arms for just over twenty-five minutes, until he left the couch.
   Among the thoughts of the recent events there were other thoughts still lingering about. I watched as gifts between friends and loved ones were exchanged while they joked and hugged... Must the past constantly remind me of my happiness, of which I currently have just a spool of twine? Watching Ms. Becky and Mr. Joe fawn over eachother, as well as observing Tremaine and Mistletoe share they're feelings for eachother freely and truthfully makes me wonder, "I am too young to think that there is not someone out there that I can do the same with."
   We must be strong! Though appearances are most always decieving. I am not as evil as I look, but I won't argue if a person feels that I may bite their head off rather than socialize, if they feel that is the case. I am usually outgoing, but I will keep my reserve.
   After a brief lapse of bordom, I broke into my bag of trinkets and pulled out my handheld videogame. What happened next was a total shock to me, as I never would have imagined someone else doing it. Someone spoke to me, "What game are you playing?" I looked up. Kich stood over me with his eye intent on knowing. I happily responded by showing him. Success! I made a new freind, it seems. The more I look at him, the more I have the feeling that he reminds me of my freind Adam, who is currently putzing around in college out of state. Also, having recently watched "UHF", Kich also reminded me of "Dr. Philo", both his appearance and his voice. I kept my mouth shut, keeping all comments to myself that I felt were unneccesary or insulting , even if they weren't...
   After thanking Blackberry several times, we stayed within the confines of his room, challenging eachother to various duels of the mind and hand eye coordination. We exchanged vocalities at times, none at all hostile, but like old friends once lost to the sands of time. Perhaps it feels that way to us all, but I know an old soul when he or she talks with me for a few minutes.
   Orion arrived a little afterwards, breaking out his X-box for whoever wanted to play. Hours passed by like a good bottle of wine being sampled by beggers.

Rather than have this whole thing turn into a short book, I'll end it here... Finish it elsewhere then make it into a short story.

~Kit, love to my friends, all of whom I would follow. What dream may come tomorrow?

The gates on the military base were locked, but I got around them through the back end. Across the street was a japanese store, and the money was burning a whole in my kid sized pockets. Traversed across the street and entered. 
After spending the yen on some kind of jelly candy, I heard the voice of a man whispering to me from the space between the store and another building. The man looked like your average bum... But it wasn't by his appearance that made me walk in there, but I do remember how I felt.
Being a curious kid, I went in, without thinking of the danger I was most likely to be in. The man was old... And from what I can tell was suffering from a cough. He was japanese, but he knew how to speak american, as I can remember only a little of what he said.
Though he did mention something about the bombing of hiroshima, it didn't seem to matter that I was american... He said something like "Kids are tools for the war propaganda" or something along those lines. But he also said he followed the ways of bushido, since he was a youngster. I didn't know what that was until I asked my parents some time later that day. 
But the funny thing about him, he did not seem crazy in the way he talked. He also spoke some Japanese but broke off into english words during a part...
I left that crevice between the buildings... I swear I heard the man cry, but I didn't want to go back inside.
There was much more that he said... Fucking age. That man is most certainly dead. He never told me his name, and I never will...
After I came back onto the military housing base I went back to my house... But with a suprise. Some of the neighborhood kids who knew me, saw me leaving the base, and spoke to my mother in my absence, (I was grounded, as I said before) and she was so angry... And relieved. She told me I could've disappeared by way of kidnapping. That too stuck in my head. I never did tell anyone about the old man in the dark crevice between the buildings, ever since.
Believe what you want. If you want proof, I can post a couple of my (Okinawan) travel pictures up from several years past.
The day we left Okinawa, Japan was not a happy day.
And I swore to go back there, in any form, by any means neccesary.
And as for the old man, who is by now dead, I will visit that crevice (Or alley if you prefer) where he once remained.
*Sigh...*
Another mentor gone, I suppose.
I guess that's all for now...
So little friends, so much time, so little left to be happy for.
See you later, mates.

~Kit - The fox, lonely but not alone.
